metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36226 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was discovered in OpenLDAP before 2.4.57 leading to a memch->bv_len miscalculation and slapd crash in the saslAuthzTo processing, resulting in denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36226` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6
libldap-common - 2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6
slapd - 2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6
slapd-contrib - 2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openldap package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.49+dfsg-2ubuntu1.6').
